meanings.definition: Engaged in a brief, unplanned fight or battle.
meanings.sent1: The skirmished soldiers quickly regrouped after the short battle.
meanings.sent2: The army's skirmished unit was always ready for unexpected attacks.
meanings.sent3: The skirmished knights ended their duel with a friendly handshake.
meanings.sent4: The skirmished clouds in the sky hinted at an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The skirmished landscape bore scars of past conflicts.

meanings.definition: Participated in a minor conflict or dispute.
meanings.sent1: The two neighbors skirmished over the property line.
meanings.sent2: The children skirmished playfully in the park.
meanings.sent3: The siblings skirmished over who got the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The teams skirmished fiercely for the championship title.
meanings.sent5: The politicians skirmished during the heated debate.
